meanings.definition: A person who operates a key or keyboard.
meanings.sent1: The keyers at the office type quickly on their keyboards.
meanings.sent2: The keyers in the typing pool are skilled at using computers.
meanings.sent3: The keyers had a race to see who could type the fastest.
meanings.sent4: She was the keyers of the group, always typing away diligently.
meanings.sent5: The keyers' fingers danced across the keyboard with precision.

meanings.definition: A device used for entering data or commands into a computer.
meanings.sent1: The new keyers made data entry much faster at the company.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to use the keyers to input the information correctly.
meanings.sent3: The keyers beeped happily when the data was entered successfully.
meanings.sent4: The keyers acted as the gatekeeper for all the computer commands.
meanings.sent5: The keyers hummed softly as it processed each keystroke.

meanings.definition: A tool used for shaping or cutting keys for locks.
meanings.sent1: The locksmith used the keyers to create a new set of keys.
meanings.sent2: The keyers helped in crafting precise keys for the locks.
meanings.sent3: The keyers made a satisfying click as they cut the key.
meanings.sent4: With the keyers, the locksmith could make keys of any shape.
meanings.sent5: The keyers were like magic wands, transforming metal into keys.
